verses.roman:
'ratnabāhu' bali' prabhu thuila tāṅra nāma
akiñcana prabhura priya kṛṣṇadāsa-nāma

synonyms: ratnabāhu—the title Ratnabāhu; bali'-calling him; prabhu—the Lord; thuila—kept; tāṅra—his; nāma—name; akiñcana—unalloyed; prabhura—of the Lord; priya—dear; kṛṣṇadāsa—of the name Kṛṣṇadāsa; nāma—name.
translation: Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu gave Vijaya dāsa the name Ratnabāhu ["jewel-handed"] because he copied many manuscripts for Him. The twenty-eighth branch was Kṛṣṇadāsa, who was very dear to the Lord. He was known as Akiñcana Kṛṣṇadāsa.

purport.content: Akiñcana means "one who possesses nothing in this world."
